A traditional Chinese ink painting (Guohua) of red spider lilies blooming on rocky cliffs above a misty river. The Lycoris swirl like flames in the wind, painted in deep red and outlined with golden brushstrokes. Jade-green leaves emerge subtly beneath the petals. In the background, elegant Chinese calligraphy characters for 'transience' and 'beauty' fade into the mist. Color palette: deep crimson, ink black, jade green, porcelain white, gold.
